video.title: Penetration Testing: Gophish Tutorial (Phishing Framework)
video.description:
Gophish is a powerful, open-source phishing framework that makes it easy to test your organization's exposure to phishing. This is an important tool for penetration testers and ethical hackers. Learn to use Gophish in this tutorial.

🎥Course from Sagar Bansal.
🔗Sagar's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdsl8fYtJM2Mw-HueDy2G4Q
🔗Sagar's website: https://sagarbansal.com/

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Didi
topLevelComment.text: I have set up a VPS droplet in Digital Ocean with a domain name (I got a free domain and it has been published) to launch the phishing campaign and I'm trying to obtain an SSL certificate for the domain using ZeroSSL. The domain verification always fails (domain verification using DNS (CNAME)). It shows the error " We were unable to verify your CNAME entry. Please check for errors on your side and try again after 5-10 minutes. " The Name, Address to point to, and TTL values for the new CNAME record which ZeroSSL asks me to add have been entered correctly as a new CNAME record in DigtalOcean but the verification test keeps failing. I have sent an email to ZeroSSL support but some annoying bot responded. Please help!

replies.author: Alvin
replies.text:
@NV Hey NV, the CD (change directory ) command worked as expected for me. I downloaded the zip file from the the gophish website and placed it in my documents folder then I unzipped it. I used the GUI (just right click on the folder and selected 'extract here'. Then I pulled up the terminal and used the cd (change directory) command to move to the directory where my gophish application was.

Linux is case sensitive so 'cd' is different from 'CD'.

topLevelComment.author: StBlade
topLevelComment.text: Very good tutorial.  Only problem is that GoPhish is dependent on an email server that you can use.  All the free email servers will block this type of communication.  So you need to be a SysAdmin with you own email server.

topLevelComment.author: Vizay Soni
topLevelComment.text: Whats the legitimate use of this? I don't think these phishing things should have any ethical use case.... They are only used for scamming purpose, and uploading this video on FreeCodeCamp is encouraging the Phishing / Scamming....

replies.author: StBlade
replies.text: This is almost a far cheaper way of doing penetration testing and educating your users.  If you had to go and buy a service like that which is offered by KnowBe4, it is going to cost you a lot.  That is without their sales department hounding you month after month if you do not accept their quotation.

replies.author: Brad Hahn
replies.text: Please tell me you're not studying ethical hacking if so it is about time someone told you that everything we do in ethical hacking can be used in a bad way, I really don't see your point. Ethical hacking has nothing to do with using things legitimately, it's all about thinking as a hacker and attacker and trying all possible outcomes yourself, so you know how best to defend yourself or client.

replies.author: Jay6395
replies.text: This tool is for sending out simulated phishing emails to a group of users or employees.  The results of you test will show you who in your organization has failed the test (by clicking on a link in the phishing email, for example).  What was missing from this tutorial was the follow-up training.  It serves no purpose to know someone is susceptible to these types of scams if you're not going to train them on how to avoid phishing emails in the future.
